lead_paragraph: VANDERWOUDE--Maurice "Mike" Henry, of New York, NY died peacefully at his home on New York's Upper West Side on February 26, 2016 at the age of 89. He was the son of Isaac and Marianne Vanderwoude who immigrated to the US. from the Netherlands. Born in Brooklyn, NY on April 22, 1926 he was raised, and raised his family, on Long Island before making New York City his final home. He served in the Army in Battery D 56th Battalion Calvary obtaining the rank of Private during WWII in the Philippines as well as Japan. After serving his country, and graduating from New York University in 1948, he embarked upon careers in graphic design and advertising, textiles, and real estate. He was President and Founder of Heritage Knitwear prior to retirement. He was a beloved husband and is survived by his wife of sixty-six years Suzanne Vanderwoude. Mike and Suzanne were patrons and collectors of art, and well known within the New York art community. He was a father of three; Mark (Deborah) Vanderwoude, Rio del Mar, CA; Paul (Laurie) Vanderwoude, Chesterbrook, PA; and Lisa (Martin) Pechter, Boca Raton, FL. His extended family includes fourteen grandchildren and seven great-grandchildren. Services will be held on Sunday, February 28, 2016 at 4pm at Riverside Memorial Chapel on 76th and Amsterdam Avenue. Shiva immediately following the Service at the Vanderwoude apartment at 90 Riverside Drive #
